Package com.gsm.repository

Interface PurchaseOrderRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<PurchaseOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<PurchaseOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<PurchaseOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<PurchaseOrder>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<PurchaseOrder,​java.lang.Long>
    @Repository
public interface PurchaseOrderRepository
extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<PurchaseOrder,​java.lang.Long>
    Spring Data JPA repository for the PurchaseOrder entity.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  PurchaseOrderRepository.MaterialRiskProjection
      An interface-based projection to hold the results of the material risk analysis query.

    • Method Detail

      • countBySaleOrderId

        @Query("SELECT count(po) FROM PurchaseOrder po JOIN po.details pod JOIN pod.orderBOMDetail obd JOIN obd.orderBOM ob WHERE ob.saleOrder.saleOrderId = :saleOrderId")
long countBySaleOrderId​(@Param("saleOrderId")
                        java.lang.Long saleOrderId)
        Counts the number of POs that have been generated from a specific Sale Order. This query joins through multiple tables to find the link.
        Parameters:
        saleOrderId - The ID of the originating Sale Order.
        Returns:
        The total count of associated POs.

      • findAllWithDetails

        @Query("SELECT DISTINCT po FROM PurchaseOrder po LEFT JOIN FETCH po.details ORDER BY po.poDate DESC, po.purchaseOrderId DESC")
java.util.List<PurchaseOrder> findAllWithDetails()
        Finds all Purchase Orders and eagerly fetches their detail lines in a single query. The `LEFT JOIN FETCH` clause is a performance optimization that prevents the "N+1 query problem" by loading the `details` collection at the same time as the `PurchaseOrder`.
        Returns:
        A list of all Purchase Orders with their details initialized.

      • findByIdWithDetails

        @Query("SELECT po FROM PurchaseOrder po LEFT JOIN FETCH po.details WHERE po.purchaseOrderId = :id")
java.util.Optional<PurchaseOrder> findByIdWithDetails​(@Param("id")
                                                      java.lang.Long id)
        Finds a single Purchase Order by its ID and eagerly fetches its detail lines.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the PO to find.
        Returns:
        An Optional containing the Purchase Order with its details.

      • findAllWithSupplier

        @Query("SELECT po FROM PurchaseOrder po JOIN FETCH po.supplier ORDER BY po.poDate DESC, po.purchaseOrderId DESC")
java.util.List<PurchaseOrder> findAllWithSupplier()
        Finds all Purchase Orders and eagerly fetches their associated suppliers. This is efficient for list views where the supplier name is always needed.
        Returns:
        A list of all Purchase Orders with their suppliers initialized.

      • findByStatus

        @Query("SELECT po FROM PurchaseOrder po JOIN FETCH po.supplier WHERE po.status = :status ORDER BY po.poDate DESC")
java.util.List<PurchaseOrder> findByStatus​(@Param("status")
                                           java.lang.String status)
        Finds all Purchase Orders with a specific status, also fetching their suppliers. Used for the "Pending Approval" screen.
        Parameters:
        status - The status to filter by (e.g., "Submitted").
        Returns:
        A list of matching Purchase Orders.

      • findMaterialRiskData

        @Query("SELECT DISTINCT so.saleOrderNo AS saleOrderNo, p.productCode AS style, so.productionStartDate AS productionStartDate, obd.materialName AS materialDescription, po.purchaseOrderNo AS purchaseOrderNo, po.arrivalDate AS poArrivalDate FROM PurchaseOrderDetail pod JOIN pod.purchaseOrder po JOIN pod.orderBOMDetail obd JOIN obd.orderBOM ob JOIN ob.saleOrder so JOIN so.details sod JOIN sod.productVariant pv JOIN pv.product p WHERE so.status = com.gsm.enums.SaleOrderStatus.InProgress AND po.arrivalDate IS NOT NULL AND so.productionStartDate IS NOT NULL")
java.util.List<PurchaseOrderRepository.MaterialRiskProjection> findMaterialRiskData()
        A query to fetch data for material risk analysis, specifically for in-progress sales orders. It joins from PurchaseOrderDetail back to SaleOrder to compare the planned material arrival date against the planned production start date.
